result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte Nazon Philon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deonte Nazon Philon in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Deonte Nazon Philon.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter (22CM283) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Deonte Nazon Philon in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Deonte Nazon Philon.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Pretrial conference held. Defense has discovery and needs to review with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with APL.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/26/22 @ 1p
